name: 1 - Inspection and Test Plan Reviewed and Approved by Customer
Specification Standard - Project Structure Specification C0702 Rev. 01 IFC structure DWG
Acceptance Criteria - Inspection and Test plan shall be submitted to the Engineer for review and approval before fabrication is commenced
2 - Inspection bearings upon receipt at site
Specification Standard - Project Structure Specification C0702 Rev. 01 IFC structure DWG
Acceptance Criteria - The material receipt at site need to be visually inspected for quantity and make sure no damage occurred during transport
3 - Remove the connecting balustrade panels between Span 6 and concrete ramp
Specification Standard - Replacing and installing permanent bearing Project Structure Specification C0702 Rev. 01 IFC struclure DWG
Acceptance Criteria - Connecting balustrade panels between Span 6 and concrele ramp to be removed
Specification Standard - Replacing and installing permanent bearing Project Structure Specification C0702 Rev. 01 IFC structure DWG

Acceptance Criteria - Place the hydraulic jack on concrete underneath the main girder once the jack is in the correct location, raise it until it touch the girder (protected surtace) but do not take any weight
Specification Standard - Replacing and installing permanent bearing Project Structure Specification C0702 Rev. 01 IFC structure DWG
Acceptance Criteria - the uplift restraint bolts need to be loosen to allow the bridge end lo be lifted
6 - Loosen bolts holding the top of the bearing
Specification Standard - Replacing and installing permanent bearing Project Structure Specification C0702 Rev. 01 IFC structure DWG
Acceptance Criteria - Bolts holding the top of the bearing need to be loosen
7 - Packer to be placed between the concrete ramp and the end girders of Span 6
Specification Standard - Replacing and installing permanent bearing Project Stn,clure Specification C0702 Rev. 01 IFC structure DWG
Acceptance Criteria - Packer to be placed between the concrete ramp and the end girders of Span 6 to minimize any possible lateral movement
Specification Standard - Replacing and installing permanent bearing Project Structure Specification C0702 Rev. 01 IFC structure DWG
Acceptance Criteria - Jack up the bridge structure with Jack no more than 5mm gap for removal the Bearing, so that wall panels between Span 5 and 6 are not displaced
9 - Packer to be placed underneath of girder
Specification Standard - Replacing and installing permanent bearing Project Structure Specification C0702 Rev. 01 IFC structure DWG
Acceptance Criteria - Packer to be placed underneath of girder to eliminate suspended load risk
10 - Remove the temporary bearing top plates
Specification Standard - Replacing and installing permanent bearing Project Structure Specification C0702 Rev. 01 IFC structure DWG
Acceptance Criteria - Unscrew the bolts and remove temporary top plates make sure bolting surtaces and threads are clean and free of debris
11 - Remove the temporary bearing bottom plates
Specification Standard - Replacing and installing permanent bearing Project Structure Specification C0702 Rev. 01 IFC structure DWG
Acceptance Criteria - Unscrew the bolts from cast in base plate to remove temporary bottom plates make sure bolting surtaces and threads are clean and free of debris
Specification Standard - Replacing and installing permanen1 bearing Project Structure Specification C0702 Rev. 01 IFC structure DWG
Acceptance Criteria - Fit the bolt loosely in base plate and bottom girder flange
Specification Standard - Replacing and installing permanent bearing Project Structure Specification C0702 Rev. 01 IFC structure DWG
Acceptance Criteria - Fit the bolt loosely in top plates
Specification Standard - Replacing and installing permanent bearing Project Structure Specification C0702 Rev. 01 IFC structure DWG
Acceptance Criteria - Lower the Jack until it is no longer taking any weight
○ Once the span has been lowered off the Jack, Remove temporary restraints on the bearings. Remove the Jack
15 - Tightening the permanent bearing Bolts and remove keeper plate
Specification Standard - Replacing and installing permanent bearing Standard operation procedure for steel structure bolt tightening SHEQ-01-02-0038
Acceptance Criteria - All Bolts need to be tightened as per Standard operation procedure for steel structure bolt tightening SHEQ-01-02-0038
Certify Doc / Ref - Bolt inspection report
Specification Standard - Replacing and installing permanent bearing Project Structure Specification C0702 Rev. 01 IFC structure DWG AS/NZS 1554.1:2014 Category SP
Acceptance Criteria - Visual and Dimensional inspections comple1ed by PFS Project Manager to verify the structural integrity and functionality of the replaced bearings
Specification Standard - Standard operation procedure for steel structure bolt tightening SHEQ-01-02-0038
Acceptance Criteria - Restraint Bolls need to be tightened as per Standard operation procedure for steel structure bolt tightening SHEQ-01-02-0038
○ Ensure the 2mm gap between keeper plate and girder webb is sustained
Certify Doc / Ref - Bolt inspection report
18 - Re-install the connecting balustrade panels between Span 6 and concrete ramp
Specification Standard - Replacing and installing permanent bearing Project Structure Specification C0702 Rev. 01 IFC structure DWG
Acceptance Criteria - Connecting balustrade panels between Span 6 and concrete ramp to be re-installed.
Specification Standard - Project Structure Specification C07 Rev. 01 IFC structure DWG
Acceptance Criteria - Documentation and reports to support installation of steel structure items compiled into PFS Manufactures Data Report
Certify Doc / Ref - PFS Manufactures Data Report

Acceptance Criteria - Following shall be submitted to the Engineer for review before fabrication is commenced:

7 - Procurement of materials in line with IFC drawings and Technical Specification
Specification Standard - Project Structure Specification C07 Rev.01 IFC structure DWG
Acceptance Criteria - Materials match that specified in Project IFC drawings and Technical Specification.
○ Structural steel Material shall be sourced from suppliers certified by ACRS
○ Material test certificates shall report all element required by AS/NZS relevant standard, plus total boron content
○ (Manufacturer certificates shall from ILAC MRA laboratories)

8 - Procurement of Welding consumable to match Weld procedure and parent materials.
Acceptance Criteria - Welding consumables and gas match what is specified on the appropriate welding procedures.

Specification Standard - Project Structure Specification C07 Rev.01 IFC structure DWG
Acceptance Criteria - Job barcodes, Inspection & Test Plan's, IFC Fabrication Drawings, Reference Drawings/Info, Welding Procedures, weld map, welding log info, traceability sheet

Acceptance Criteria - Dimensional survey of fabricated item's against IFC drawings.

Specification Standard - Project Structure Specification C07 Rev. 01 IFC structure DWG SHEQ-01-02-0040
Acceptance Criteria - Dimensional survey of fabricated item's against IFC drawings.
○ Measured dimensions shall be within Functional Tolerances class 2 as per AS/NZS 5131 Table F2.1 to F2.10
13 - Identification and traceability for main items
Specification Standard - Project Structure Specification C07 Rev. 01 IFC structure DWG AS/NZS 5131

Acceptance Criteria - Lot traceability shall be provided for main structural members, connections between main structural members and major plate components. Tracibility as per AS/NZS 5131:Amd 1 :2020 5.2.3 (ii) for minor components including cleats, connecting brackets and the like.
14 - Manufacture of steel structure Tack welded only
Acceptance Criteria - Manufacture completed as per IFC Fabrication drawings. All tack welding shall be performed in accordance with PFS weld procedure.
○ Welding consumables, process & any applicable pre/post heat requirements shall comply with approved welding procedure's.
Acceptance Criteria - Dimensional survey of fabricated items against IFC drawings.
○ Measured dimensions shall be within stated tolerances unless noted otherwise.
○ Functional Tolerances shall be class 2 as per AS/NZS 5131 Table F2.1 to F2.10
○ Inspections recorded in line with SHEQ-01-02-0035 Product lnspection Procedure
Acceptance Criteria - All welding shall be performed in accordance with PFS weld procedures

○ Welding consumables, process & any applicable pre/post heat requirements shall comply with approved welding procedure's. Welder ID, weld date & consumable batch are recorded on traceability register.
Certify Doc / Ref - Welding Procedure and Welder Qualification
Acceptance Criteria - Dimensional survey of fabricated items against IFC drawings.
○ Measured dimensions shall be within stated tolerances unless noted otherwise.
○ Functional Tolerances shall be class 2 as per AS/NZS 5131 Table F2.1 to F2.10
○ Inspections recorded in line with SHEQ-01-02-0035 Product lnsnection Procedure
Certify Doc / Ref - IFC DWGs & Workshop Pack.
Acceptance Criteria - 100% of all welds shall be subject to visual scanning
Certify Doc / Ref - PFS NDT Register
Specification Standard - Project Structure Specification C07 Rev. 01
Acceptance Criteria - NOE shall include as a minimum:
○ 100% Visual Scanning, 100% Visual examination, 100% UT examination of all butt weld, 10% MT examination for fillet weld
○ The Welding Compliance Inspector shall complete all inspections including any additional inspection, tests and reports necessary due to any welding or welding related workmanship defects.
Certify Doc / Ref - Stamped NDT report
Specification Standard - Project Structure Specification C07 Rev. 01
Acceptance Criteria - Removal of all weld spatter and dressing of any weld to removed sharp edges/ spatter.
○ All sharp edges are ground to a smooth 2 mm radius.
Specification Standard - Project Structure Specification C07 Rev. 01
Acceptance Criteria - All Non-conformities reported in PFS NCR system during manufacturing of steel structure need to be submitted to Client for approval

1 - Inspection and Test Plan Reviewed and Approved by Customer
Acceptance Criteria - Inspection and Test plan shall be submitted to the Engineer for review and approval before fabrication is commenced.
Certify Doc / Ref - ITP-002-39028- Span 2 Rev C
Specification Standard - Specification for coating steelwork on highway structure IFC structure DWG
Acceptance Criteria - Coating Specification: Zinc metal thermal Spray TSZ150S and Sealer coat
○ Paint Specification - Anti Graffiti paint system
Certify Doc / Ref - Painting Project Commencement Meeting Minutes
Specification Standard - Specification for coating steelwork on highway structure NZTA S9

Acceptance Criteria - Testing panels (250 mm x 250 mm) showing Blasted surface profile and the metal spray (unsealed and sealed) to be provided along with material certificate, manufacturer's data sheet, brand of sealer, equipment type and set up parameter, name of operator who prepared panel. After satisfactory testing of the sample panel, none of the above items shall be changed.
Certify Doc / Ref - Inspection report by Paint inspector
4 - Confirmation on protective coatings preparation by painting contractor
Specification Standard - Project Structure Specification C07 Rev. 01 AS/NZS 5131 Clause 9.8.4
Acceptance Criteria - The surface needs to be in comply with P3 Treatment based on AS/NZS 5131 clause 9.8.4
○ Removal of all burrs, fins and weld defect, weld spatter, wold slags and dressing of any weld to removed sharp edges / spatter, undercut, visible porosity.
○ All sharp edges are ground to a smooth 2 mm radius.
Specification Standard - Specification for coating steelwork on highway structure NZTA S9 AS/NZS 5131
Acceptance Criteria - Any surface contamination shall be removed in accordance with NACE No. 2/ SSPC-SP 10 (AS 1627.1). Abrasive blast to SSPC-SP 10 (AS 1627.4 Sa 2 1/2)
○ Surface profile shall be within 40 µm to 75µm
○ Surface preparation shall not be Carried out in following condition:
a) when surface temperature arc less than 3C above dew point
b) when the relative humidity of the air is above 85%
c) in condition of poor visibility with light below 200 Ix
Certify Doc / Ref - ITP signed to verify blasting completed to Class 2½ finish. Contractor paint inspection report.
Acceptance Criteria - The coating should be uniform in thickness without excessive drips, sags, porosity or inconsistencies.
○ Thickness measurement need to be performed and thickness to be in range of 150 micron ±20%
Certify Doc / Ref - Contractor paint inspection report
Specification Standard - Specification for coating steelwork on highway structure NZTA S9
Acceptance Criteria - A mist coat of Penguard Universal (low viscosity epoxy sealer) to be applied within 2.5 hours after application of thermal metal spray
○ Penguard Universal applied to minimum 50 µm DFT
○ The coating shall be free from breaks in the coating, runs, sags, wrinkles, fat edge, dust or sand, irregular coated patches, dry spray, brush mark, blisters and pin holes
Certify Doc / Ref - Contractor paint inspection report
Specification Standard - Specification for coating steelwork on highway structure NZTA S9
Acceptance Criteria - Recoating interval needs lo be considered based on paint data sheet and ambient temperature
○ Penguard Universal applied to minimum 150 µm DFT.
○ The coating shall be free from breaks in the coating, runs, sags, wrinkles, fat edge, dust or sand, irregular coated patches, dry spray, brush mark, blisters and pin holes
Certify Doc / Ref - Contractor paint inspection report
Specification Standard - Specification for coating steelwork on highway structure NZTA S9
Acceptance Criteria - Recoating interval needs to be considered based on paint data sheet and ambient temperature
○ Hardtop Optima applied to minimum 75 µm DFT.
○ The coating shall be free from break in the coating, runs, sags, wrinkles, fa ledge, dust or sand, irregular coated patches, dry spray, brush mark, blisters and pin holes
Certify Doc / Ref - Coating application record by Coating contractor. Coating inspection report by Inspector.
10 - Adhesion test on plate sample which painted along with steel structure
Specification Standard - Specification for coating steelwork on highway structure NZTA S9 ASTM D3359
Acceptance Criteria - Adhesion test shall be performed on plate sample determined by the X-cut tape test using method A of ASTM D3359
○ The acceptance criteria is 4A (Approve adhesive tape is 3M No. 810 scotch Magic Tape transparent pressure sensitive paint)
Certify Doc / Ref - Coating application record by Coating contractor. Coating inspection report by Inspector.
11 - Visual Inspection of steel structure, Approved for Transport to PFS
Specification Standard - Specification for coating steelwork on highway structure NZTA S9
Acceptance Criteria - Items covered by ITP visually inspected, any defects to be remediated before transrorting from protective coating facility.
Certify Doc / Ref - Coating application record by Coating contractor. Coating inspection report by Inspector.
